thread: Cox Communications outage or service down? Current problems and outages
raw message: I'm so tired of this. I don't know WTF is going on with Cox in the past 2 months in Metairie, LA but it's just unacceptable. Signal dropping CONSTANTLY, especially in the middle of football games. Both cable and Internet going out at the SAME TIME, which mean's there's something wrong with their nodes or other infrastructure on the utility poles, and it never seems to change. Some days nothing happens, then the next day it goes out again multiple times. It's strange because months ago there were hardly any issues that I noticed, but now every single day I'm watching tv / on the Internet and the cable signal goes out, and so does the Internet.   We have also been in an outage almost every single day, despite the signals coming back usually 5 or so minutes as the outage begins, it's crazy. I check the webpage every time it goes out and there's a reported outage in my area, which means Cox won't send out techs the next day if you call them. I cannot wait for AT&T to install fiber in my neighborhood so I can ditch Cox's awful service for good.

thread: Cox Communications outage or service down? Current problems and outages
raw message: Internet in Owasso, OK has been flaky for 2 days now. 300/30 (down/up) service tops out at about 200/5 per speedtest.net -- often less than that.    Of more impact is that a number of sites I access regularly cannot be accessed. Firefox returns "The page isn’t redirecting properly. Firefox has detected that the server is redirecting the request for this address in a way that will never complete. This problem can sometimes be caused by disabling or refusing to accept cookies." The web console shows 302 (temporary) redirects looping between the site in question and IP 184.178.98.85 -- an IP address allocated to Cox. The same sites can be accessed with no problems using my phone (using mobile data, not WiFi).     The problem is affecting some sites consistently (although occasionally a given site may be accessible for a while) while other sites are not affected.     Both the modem and router (separate devices) have been power cycled with no change.   For those reporting Internet outages, are you experiencing similar problems?

I’ve called Cox tech support almost each time this happens, which is at least 6, not including today, and the responses are incredibly vague and unhelpful.   There was some generic literature sent out by Cox via snail mail a few weeks ago about network upgrades happening in Vegas soon, but it didn’t advise that internet would be up and down so often. raw message: Internet was down for an outage in West Warwick yesterday 6/18/2019 from 10am to 4pm, now this morning it doesn't work again. Now I am on hold with cox. Before I called Cox, I reset my modem and rebooted my computer. I work from home and already missed a full work day yesterday. They NEVER offer any discounts for these inconveniences, and this happens at least 3 or 4 times a year. I could understand if we had bad weather or a storm. If they tell me it will take 3 days to send someone out, I will lose my shit.  OK the lady comes back after 7 minutes and then tells me that the are not responsible for my wifi, and she wants to know can I connect by hardwire, LIKE WTF who has hard wire set up's anymore. The lady is rude, she takes no responsibility, she LIES and says that there is not an outage again today, yet I can see 69% of people in Warwick have their internet down right now. They REFUSE to send anyone to fix it until tomorrow at 10am. The lady doesn't care that this is costing me 3 day of paid work, because I work from home.  I am calling Verizon and changing service providers. thread: Cox Communications outage or service down? Current problems and outages
raw message: I called Cox once again.  This time made service tech appointment because of frustration. Then... I told myself, I can fix this issue. I FIXED the issue even after all the CS and nonsense. After pinging and tracert and other "stuff", I knew it was a small but hidden secret. I just had to find it. SOLUTION for Cox cable box not connecting to TV: unplug the coaxial cable and power to [ ALL CABLE BOXES IF MORE THAN 1 in the house] the cable box, and your TV. Let sit for 30 minutes or longer, is better. Then power on the TV, then plug in the coaxial cable to box, then plug in the power cable to Cox cable box. Turn on TV. The issue is that if you have more than 1 cable box in the house, BOTH need to be simutaneously unplugged and disconnected so the Cox Router will reset the data log on the router on the Cox server. That is my best guess. But it worked. No thanks to COX. I really did not want a service tech to try to scam my elderly father out of saved earnings. I can only imagine all those that get taken. SMILES!

thread: Cox Communications outage or service down? Current problems and outages
raw message: I'm ready for Cox to come up with an explanation for the outage today, April 10 in West Phoenix. Earlier in the day they reported on their phone app that it would be fixed at 5:29 pm. It was down and out most of the day, then came back at a much-throttled slower speed later in the afternoon. Then, at 5:29 right on the dot it came back up to speed.   Now, I absolutely do not believe in coincidences. Until I hear differently I'm going to believe that Cox is performing rolling outages to alleviate bandwidth over-usage by all of the work-at-homers and Netflix watchers who are home because of the virus panic.   5:29 on the dot? Come on!   To make matters worse, Verizon chose today to upgrade its cell phone towers in Phoenix for 5G, so cell phone calling was out too. We didn't have the option to use wifi-calling because, guess what, Internet was down.   My wife and I are both working at home, and I'm going to be VERY unhappy if these outages continue and we lose our jobs.

thread: Cox Communications outage or service down? Current problems and outages
raw message: I am a cox tech due to corona virus we cannot go into your homes we can check the speed at side of your house. If you getting slow speeds 99.9% time it’s inside your house. I’m give you a run down check list most common problems. 1 your modem single band and not duo band meaning there’s to many devices on that single band.  2. Someone spliced into the line with a store bought splitter where you are now getting ingress  3. You modem on a amp that’s in the basement 4 you no longer have cable boxes and your open lines in the house are draining from modem. 5 your modem is out of date and what your paying for the modem drop because to much signal. 6 a amp in your basement has no power 7 animal chewed the wire cat dog rodent  8 not enough power going to modem 9 didn’t do it’s update then unplug and plug it back in 10 modem blown and needs to be replaced.

thread: Cox Communications outage or service down? Current problems and outages
raw message: I always recommend to do separate units. Double check with coax on what their current approved DOCSIS cable modems are for whatever service you have, never hurts to plan for future upgrades. You can also save money by buying a used or refurbished one, standalone modems rarely go bad.  As far as routers I don't ever recommend consumer grade anymore. They're set for ease of use and speed and gaming and not really security. depending on how technologically advanced you are you may be able to do a lot better with an SMB or SOHO device. PF sense/netgate, microtic, ubiquity. they all have a much deeper learning curve than it's consumer grade one but they have far more options and security features available.
